moves.1... e6: I play for the French, a favorite of mine.
moves.2... d5: Now it is a type of French, it appears.
moves.3. b3: White has horrible black holes leading into his base.
moves.3... Bb4+ 4. Bd2 Bxd2+: Here I lose control of the dark squares.
moves.5. Qxd2 Nc6: Developing my Knight and hitting the d4 pawn.
moves.10. Nc3 e5: Pushing the pawn to bust Black's center, and opening up the c8-h3 diagonal.
moves.11. dxe5 Nxe5 12. cxd5: Okay, he wants to totally lose control of the center, it appears.
moves.14... Rh5: Why not? Puts pressure on the King.
moves.15. Rac1 Nxc3: This move loses. Better to reposition it to e7, then to g6, to better attack the King.
moves.22. h4 Qg4 23. Qf2 f6 24. e4 Ra5: Much better was Rc5, where I could hope to trade off Rooks.
moves.28. Qf7+ Kh8 29. Qg7#: There it is. A decent middlegame followed by a terrible late-middlegame/horrid endgame. Please comment, since this is a training annotation.
